channel.title: Php, xampp WHAT?!
channel.description: Ok, so im extremely new to php and im trying to get something up and going. So i downloaded xampp (the one that is in the highscore tut) and i got apache set up and everything no problem. I guess my question is. How does php work? For example: When a user clicks register, fills out their shit and clicks register or submit does it (i dont know what it is btw) check your php file (maybe named check_login?) and if its already a user just tells them the username is takin? Im not exactly sure if thats how it works.. Is there a way you could explain it to me or take me through a crash course? Thanks guys

item.title: Php, xampp WHAT?!
item.dc:creator: @Slave_Scyth Slave Scyth
item.description:
@Slave_Scyth wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I, post:1, topic:353320”][quote author=pure2ownage link=topic=449621.msg3298620#msg3298620 date=1281120750]
That is MySQL my friend, PHP (Hyper-Text Pre-Processor) is a webscripting language.

<?php echo Hello Jal Knight ?>Double quotes for strings and single for characters in all languages, imo. But eh, I guess at least with PHP it’s personal preference.

MySQL is basically a database made up of tables (ofc) which you request a username / password / other information when doing something which you want.
e.g. for logging in it should request your username, password ect. if they match the one’s in the database you will successfully be logged in
[/quote]

Fail PHP dude.

[PHP]

<?php echo 'Hello, Jal Knight'; ?>

[/php][/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: Php, xampp WHAT?!
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

You’re going to want to learn a little bit about PHP and MySQL before you try and jump straight into this…

But to answer your question, When the user clicks Register it will execute the PHP script you’ve choosen. Inside the script you’d want it to connect to a database, and check if the user already exists. If it does give some sort of error message, and let them try again. If the username is free it would then insert it into the database, and usually continue with logging the user in and taking them back to the home page.

When they click Login, it would check the database for the username, and if it doesn’t exist give an error message, but if it does exist it would then check the passwords, and if they matched it would log them in and take them to the home page.

PHP MySQL functions
PHP Function Reference

And if you have any more questions, its usually pretty easy to just Google search something like “php mysql database connect” and usually it would return the function ref from php.net first, and then most of the links on the first page are extremely useful for examples, discussion, etc.

Read full topic

item.title: Php, xampp WHAT?!
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

That is MySQL my friend, PHP (Hyper-Text Pre-Processor) is a webscripting language.

<?php echo Hello Jal Knight ?>

MySQL is basically a database made up of tables (ofc) which you request a username / password / other information when doing something which you want.
e.g. for logging in it should request your username, password ect. if they match the one’s in the database you will successfully be logged in
